All households produce mangrove swamp rice (both O. glaberrima and O. sativa varieties), but they mostly value African rice varieties (see also Table 4). This community does not grow vegetables or have fruit trees as they have almost no permanent dry land on the island and the village of Arame occupies their upland territory. Almost all households have chickens and pigs (98.1% and 96.2% respectively), about half of the families have goats (49.1%), a third have cows (34.0%), and only a quarter raise ducks (24.5%). There are very few cows, and these are usually collectively owned by the descent groups as they are used in ceremonies and rituals, and any pigs, goats, and chickens are frequently killed by epidemics.Table 4
